intro: Sphaerostigma alyssoides, commonly known as the white alyssum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. It has basal leaves that are linear and covered in fine hairs. Sphaerostigma alyssoides is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
